gospel.text:
[[Lc 1,46]]Mary said: "My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord;
[[Lc 1,47]]my spirit rejoices in God my savior.
[[Lc 1,48]]For he has looked with favor on his lowly servant; 
from this day all generations will call me blessed.
[[Lc 1,49]]The Almighty has done great things for me, 
and holy is his name.
[[Lc 1,50]]He has mercy on those who fear him
in every generation.
[[Lc 1,51]]He has shown might with his arm, dispersed the arrogant of mind and heart.
[[Lc 1,52]]He has thrown down the rulers from their thrones but lifted up the lowly.
[[Lc 1,53]]He has filled the hungry with good things; 
and the rich he has sent away empty.
[[Lc 1,54]]He has come to the help of his servant Israel , 
remembering his promise of mercy,
[[Lc 1,55]]The promise he made to our fathers, 
to Abraham and to his descendants forever."
[[Lc 1,56]]Mary remained with her about three months and then returned to her home.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.text:
[[1_S 2,1]]My heart exults in the LORD, 
my horn is exalted in my God. 
I have swallowed up my enemies; 
I rejoice in my victory.

[[1_S 2,4]]The bows of the mighty are broken, 
while the tottering gird on strength.
[[1_S 2,5]]The well-fed hire themselves out for bread, 
while the hungry batten on spoil. 
The barren wife bears seven sons, 
while the mother of many languishes.

[[1_S 2,6]]The LORD puts to death and gives life; 
He casts down to the nether world; 
He raises up again.
[[1_S 2,7]]The LORD makes poor and makes rich, 
He humbles, he also exalts.

[[1_S 2,8a]]He raises the needy from the dust;
[[1_S 2,8b]]from the dung heap he lifts up the poor,
[[1_S 2,8c]]to seat them with nobles
[[1_S 2,8d]]and make a glorious throne their heritage.
psalm.title: 1st book of Samuel

first_reading.text:
[[1_S 1,24]]In those days Hannah brought Samuel with her, along with a three-year-old bull, an ephah of flour, and a skin of wine, and presented him at the temple of the LORD in Shiloh.
[[1_S 1,25]]After the boy's father had sacrificed the young bull, Hannah, his mother, approached Eli
[[1_S 1,26]]and said: "Pardon, my lord! As you live my lord, I am the woman who stood near you here, praying to the LORD.
[[1_S 1,27]]I prayed for this child, and the LORD granted my request.
[[1_S 1,28]]Now I, in turn, give him to the LORD; as long as he lives, he shall be dedicated to the LORD." She left Samuel there.
first_reading.title: 1st book of Samuel
